title: Condensed Sans Serif w/ Personality
content:
I'm working on a magazine mast identity and I'm having trouble finding a bold, condensed sans serif that is expressive, unique, fun, approachable, etc.

All of the ones I've looked at (see attached): Helvetica, Univers, Akzidenz, Franklin Gothic, Gotham don't seem to feel right. The publication name is long and I'm looking for an elegant solution.

Any thoughts? Thanks,

Sam

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Magazine Samples.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315225656/http:/typophile.com/files/Magazine%20Samples.jpg) | 109.4 KB |
author: Sam Serif

comments.content: Thanks Fab, I looked at Knockout early on and felt it wasn't quite unique enough. Unfortunately my mast will not have an R—Knockout's star letter. Tasse seemed a little serious/techy, but had a good dose of personality.

I like Interstate in caps. DIN 1451 Mittelschrift is also nice and comes in a condensed version. You might want to check this as well. [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/saa/series-a-d/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315225656/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/saa/series-a-d/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/saa/series-a-d/")

Elegant, condensed, expressive -- sounds like you need to get some more stroke contrast in there.

[ITC Roswell](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315225656/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/itc_roswell_four/&sample_text=MAGCORPORATION&sample_size=74)  
 [Strayhorn](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315225656/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/strayhorn_mt_std_bold/&sample_text=MAGCORPORATION&sample_size=44)  
 [Donatello](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315225656/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/letterperfect/donatello/&sample_text=MagCorporation&sample_size=45)  
 [Corvallis Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315225656/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/corvallis_sans/&sample_text=MAGCORPORATION&sample_size=48)

I think you'll have a lot more options with personality if you go upper and lowercase rather than all caps.

And don't forget:  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/SamSans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315225656/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/SamSans "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/SamSans") ;-)

[http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/GarageGothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315225656/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/GarageGothic "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/GarageGothic")  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/TitlingGothicFB](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315225656/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/TitlingGothicFB "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/TitlingGothicFB")  
 and the not quite unique but newly updated,

Cheers!

Why not try [Sophisto](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315225656/http:/www.macrhino.com/)? Maybe this is what you are looking for?

_Sorry, couldn't resist! ;)_

Oh that reminds me of another idea: [FF Lancé](http://web.archive.org/web/20150315225656/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_lance_condensed/).

Great call Marco, I'm not sure why I overlooked Verlag Compressed (I actually like the Condensed more). Neutra Condensed is even more beautiful ... and not as strange as I would have guessed. Neutra really shows it's personality in body copy with those low x-heights. It really looks great as display.
